doc.after: Today the museum no longer houses collections of natural history and the books and manuscripts it once held now form part of the independent British Library The Museum nevertheless preserves its universality in its collections of artefacts representing the cultures of the world ancient and modern The original 1753 collection has grown to over thirteen million objects at the British Museum 70 million at the Natural History Museum and 150 million at the British Library
